column4: does anyone know how to find the wine folder/programs in 11.10
you mean it's not under ~/.wine like before?
no the folder does not exist in home like it did before update
and it isn't found in unity by program name
ouch
yes :(
would it matter whether your 11.10 was a fresh install or an upgrade?
after searching the net I find that I'm not the only one and a real fix hasn't been posted
my upgrade to 11.04 it was fine, it wasn't until the 11.10 upgrade when it vanished
for a new diagnostic data point, you might try making a fresh install on a separate disk partition
or partition(s)
I'll pass on that for now it's busy season at work and I'm trying to convince the boss we should be using ubuntu... don't have time to reinstall everything
thanks for the response though... maybe you can help with another issue
may I didn't say it right; the idea being you leave the existing system intact while building a disposable 11.10 installation for testing purposes only
my workspaces have turned black when activated... the wallpaper is removed after doing updates last night
but it shows all the apps in each space
but I see why you'd not want to experiment much on a production system
yes it's just the production aspect... it's busy season and I don't have time to tinker in the office
glad if I could help, what's the other issue?
my workspaces lost the wallpaper and everything is black when activated after running updates last night. however the apps still show in all 4 spaces
if you're talking unity, i'm really not familiar
ahh ok. well I'll go do some work and ask in here later, maybe someone else will know. thanks for taking the time though
